H0.text: Storing trash bags is the activity that makes the most air pollution.

H1.text: Reusing trash bags is the activity that makes the most air pollution.

H2.text: Burning trash bags makes the most air pollution among the listed activities.

H3.text: Recycling trash bags is the activity that produces the most air pollution.

A4.text: Incineration plants emitted fewer particles, hydrocarbons and less SO2, HCl, CO and NOx than coal-fired power plants, but more than natural gasâ€“fired power plants.

A5.text: Incineration of municipal solid waste avoids the release of methane.

A6.text: Open dumps of waste are a common source of air pollution in low-income countries.

A7.text: They are stable and benign in sanitary landfills.

A8.text: Incinerated plastics release a number of toxins in the burning process, including dioxins, furans, mercury, and polychlorinated biphenyls.

A9.text: Most discarded plastics end up incinerated or in landfills, where they emit methane as they decompose.

A10.text: Incineration of 1 ton of MSW produces approximately 1 ton of CO2.

A11.text: According to Germany's Ministry of the Environment, waste incinerators reduce the amount of some atmospheric pollutants by substituting power produced by coal-fired plants with power from waste-fired plants.
